importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article's publication, indicating when the death of Doug Martin was announced to the public.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Doug Martin's NFL career spanned from 2012 to 2018, with key achievements in 2012 and 2015, marking the time period during which he played professionally and earned accolades.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after playing at Boise State.
He rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin earned a Pro Bowl berth in his rookie season and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
He also caught 148 passes for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers described his passing as sudden and unexpected and acknowledged his lasting impact on the franchise.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during the team’s 50th-anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. A standout college player at Boise State, he was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft and quickly established himself as a top performer, rushing for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons. He earned a Pro Bowl berth in his rookie year and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015. Martin was also recognized as one of the top 50 players in the Buccaneers’ 50-year franchise history, underscoring his lasting impact on the team. The Buccaneers expressed deep sorrow over his sudden and unexpected passing.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
